name: qsv-snappy
description: Does streaming compression/decompression of the input using Google's Snappy framing format (more info).

args.name: input
args.description: The input file to compress/decompress. This can be a local file, stdin, or a URL (http and https schemes supported).

options.description: The number of jobs to run in parallel when compressing. When not set, its set to the number of CPUs - 1
Write output to <output> instead of stdout.
Show download progress bars. Only valid for URL input.
Timeout for downloading URLs in seconds. [default: 60]

Specify custom user agent to use when the input is a URL. It supports the following variables - $QSV_VERSION, $QSV_TARGET, $QSV_BIN_NAME, $QSV_KIND and $QSV_COMMAND. Try to follow the syntax here - https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/User-Agent
